title: How to Make Masoor Curry

Grind the cool mixture to paste with the help of a mixer grinder.
Mix the ground paste of coconut to the potatoes cubes.
Boil the mixture on low gas flame.

text:
Soak the masoor overnight. Later cook them in a pressure cooker. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bd/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid4076876-v4-728px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Boil the potatoes and cut them into medium size cubes. Add the oil to a frying pan. When heated, add the garlic cloves and fine sliced onion. Stir until golden brown. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/aid4076876-v4-728px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Later add the grated coconut. Stir fry until golden brown. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/c5/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/aid4076876-v4-728px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Let the fried ingredients cool and add garam masala powder. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/86/Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/aid4076876-v4-728px-Make-Masoor-Curry-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Grind the cool mixture to paste with the help of a mixer grinder. Mix the ground paste of coconut to the potatoes cubes. Add cooked masoor. Boil the mixture on low gas flame. Add salt to taste. Garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or rotis.
